docs.lead_paragraph: An investigation offers a sobering portrait of how Wyckoff Heights Medical Center has been undermined by the very people entrusted to run it.

headline.seo: At Ailing Wyckoff Hospital, Insider Deals and Lavish Perks
headline.main: At Ailing Brooklyn Hospital, Insider Deals and Lavish Perks
headline.print_headline: At Ailing Brooklyn Hospital, Insider Deals and Lavish Perks

docs.abstract: Three-month investigation into Wyckoff Heights Medical Center in Brooklyn offers a sobering portrait of how it, as a nonprofit hospital, has been undermined by the very people entrusted to run it; facility has been so troubled for so long that even the most accomplished leadership might have been unable to turn it around; but its recent difficulties, which are attracting the notice of the authorities, have clearly been deepened by management turmoil.
docs.snippet: An investigation offers a sobering portrait of how Wyckoff Heights Medical Center has been undermined by the very people entrusted to run it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Practice sessions for the lawyers debating President Obama’s health care law in Supreme Court arguments this week have stretched the supply of colleagues willing to play the justices.

headline.seo: In Supreme Court Health Care Case, Training for a Legal Marathon
headline.main: In Health Care Case, Lawyers Train for 3-Day Marathon
headline.print_headline: 3-Day Marathon Awaits Lawyers In Health Case

docs.abstract: Lawyers involved in the three days of Supreme Court arguments on the constitutionality of President Obama's health care law have been practicing for what will be a legal marathon; problem is not just the length of the arguments the court will hear, but the variety of topics that need to be addressed; decision in the case will have enormous practical consequences for how health care is delivered in the United States.
docs.snippet: Practice sessions for the lawyers debating President Obama’s health care law in Supreme Court arguments this week have stretched the supply of colleagues willing to play the justices.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: On Monday, the Supreme Court will begin three days of arguments over the constitutionality of the Affordable Care Act. The act is often called ''Obamacare,'' primarily by Republicans, as a term of disdain. Democrats have tried to limit the term's use to reshape perceptions, but that has been a tough sell. Grant Barrett, a vice president for the American Dialect Society, says it is almost impossible to persuade people to discontinue the use of a political word. ''It's an invitation to have your heart broken. You forbid it, and they start writing it on the bathroom stalls.'' Now Democrats seem to be embracing the term, launching a Twitter campaign that seeks to build positive associations for it.

headline.main: Fighting to Control the Meaning of ''Obamacare''

docs.abstract: Timeline explores the battle between Republicans and Democrats to control the meaning of 'Obamacare,' term that was originally coined by conservatives to refer derisively to Pres Obama's new health care law. Photos, Graph (M)1

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s complicated relationship with Senator Edward M. Kennedy, from campaign foe to health care partner, helped shape both his political career and his image.

headline.seo: Ted Kennedy Helped Shape Mitt Romney’s Career, and Still Haunts It
headline.main: Kennedy Helped Shape Romney’s Career, and Still Haunts It

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney's complicated relationship with Sen Edward M Kennedy, from campaign foe to health care partner, helped shaped both his political career and his image, and remains a factor in the 2012 presidential election; Romney ran a failed Senatorial campaign against Kennedy in 1994, then partnered with the senator as governor of Massachusetts to enact landmark health care law in 2006; Romney regularly invokes Kennedy's name on the campaign trail as a symbol of wasteful liberalism; (Series: The Long Run).
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney’s complicated relationship with Senator Edward M. Kennedy, from campaign foe to health care partner, helped shape both his political career and his image.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nine justices will need steely nerves to block out all the noise surrounding its review this week of the Obama administration’s sweeping health care law.

headline.seo: Lobby Groups Blanket Supreme Court On Obama Health Care Plan
headline.main: Groups Blanket Supreme Court on Health Care
headline.print_headline: Groups Blanket Supreme Court On Health Care

docs.abstract: Supreme Court justices will need steely nerves to block out the din surrounding its review the Obama administration's sweeping health care law; advocates on all sides of the issue have spent tens of millions of dollars on lobbying to steer the political and legal debate, and a record number of organizations have filed amicus briefs, urging the court to either uphold or strike down the law.
docs.snippet: The nine justices will need steely nerves to block out all the noise surrounding its review this week of the Obama administration’s sweeping health care law.

byline.original: By LINCOLN CAPLAN and PHILIP M. BOFFEY

docs.lead_paragraph: Analysts are finding huge disparities in the amounts that private insurance plans pay for common medical procedures, which go undetected by patients and their doctors.
docs.abstract: Editorial observes that health care analysts are finding huge disparities in the amounts that private insurance plans pay for common medical procedures; questions why such gaps exist.
